com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.layout

Class GridLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.layout.GridLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LayoutManager, Serializable

    public class GridLayout
extends Object
implements LayoutManager
    GridLayout is a LayoutManager that emulates GridLayout.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis, Mark Reeves
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridLayout

        public GridLayout(int rows,
          int cols)
        Creates a grid layout with the specified number of rows and columns.

        One, but not both, of rows and cols can be zero, which means that any number of objects can be placed in a row or in a column.

        Parameters:
        rows - the rows, with the value zero meaning any number of rows.
        cols - the columns, with the value zero meaning any number of columns.

      • GridLayout

        @Deprecated
public GridLayout(int rows,
                     int cols,
                     int hgap,
                     int vgap)
        Deprecated. use GridLayout(int, int, Size, Size)
        Creates a grid layout with the specified number of rows and columns and spacing.
        Parameters:
        rows - the rows, with the value zero meaning any number of rows
        cols - the columns, with the value zero meaning any number of columns
        hgap - the space between the columns
        vgap - the space between the rows

      • GridLayout

        public GridLayout(int rows,
          int cols,
          Size hSpace,
          Size vSpace)
        Creates a grid layout with the specified number of rows and columns.

        In addition, the horizontal and vertical spaces are set to the specified values. Horizontal spaces are placed between each of the columns. Vertical spaces are placed between each of the rows.

        One, but not both, of rows and cols can be zero, which means that any number of objects can be placed in a row or in a column.

        All GridLayout constructors defer to this one.

        Parameters:
        rows - the rows, with the value zero meaning any number of rows
        cols - the columns, with the value zero meaning any number of columns
        hSpace - the space between the columns
        vSpace - the space between the rows

        Returns:

        @Deprecated

        the horizontal gap between the cells measured in pixels

      • getVgap

        @Deprecated
public int getVgap()
        Deprecated. use getVerticalGap()
        Returns:
        the vertical gap between the cells measured in pixels

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Returns:
        the number of rows, or 0 for a dynamic number of rows based on the number of components and columns.

      • getCols

        public int getCols()
        Returns:
        the number of columns, or 0 for a dynamic number of column based on the number of components and rows.
